title: Can models be part of Docker image?

content.raw:
When I started docker via DockerHub install:

[#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub)

and all docker images were downloaded, on start it tries to connect to [fuel.ignitionrobotics.org](http://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org) to download some models. So the run is no longer deterministic \(now it failed due to connectivity problems\). Is it possible to have all necessary files part of the docker or is it bad idea? It would also mean that if you modify the models it would be necessary to rebuild the docker image.
content.html:
When I started docker via DockerHub install:

#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub

and all docker images were downloaded, on start it tries to connect to fuel.ignitionrobotics.org to download some models. So the run is no longer deterministic (now it failed due to connectivity problems). Is it possible to have all necessary files part of the docker or is it bad idea? It would also mean that if you modify the models it would be necessary to rebuild the docker image.
